channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Demand for cleaners rockets as lockdown restrictions lifted and home visits given the green light
item.description: Online searches for 'book a cleaner' quadrupled yesterday following the confirmation families are now allowed to bring in domestic help.

item.title: Instagram model who was fired for being 'too pretty' now earns $60K by sharing sexy pictures online
item.description: Stephanie Villagomez, 29, says she lost numerous jobs because of her looks, recalling one boss who fired her because his wife was jealous of her appearance.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Rishi Sunak admits recession already happening
item.description: The Chancellor said it was already clear that the furlough scheme would have to go well beyond its current deadline of the end of June.

item.title: Holiday firms demand cash for trips that look set to be cancelled
item.description: Pensioners Avril and Peter Brewer (pictured) had planned to treat their son, his wife and their two young children to a once-in-a-lifetime holiday to Orlando, Florida, in August.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Rishi Sunak extends furlough scheme to October
item.description: Rishi Sunak said the subsidy, which had been due to end next month, will stay in place for four more months, and it will still cover 80 per cent of wages up to a ceiling of £2,500 a month.

item.title: Hasidic Jews ignore social distancing rules during coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Around 300 revellers were spotted gathering in Stamford Hill despite Government advice that only one person from each household can meet with one other outside their household.

item.title: Officials in Norwich plan to test all 140,000 residents for coronavirus EVERY WEEK
item.description: Scientists working in the city's labs want to be the first in the UK to check every resident so they can track the virus and halt its spread.

item.title: Families at war over broadband: Home internet use soars under lockdown
item.description: The poor internet connection in Fiona Scott's house means each day, the family of five (pictured) must decide who gets priority as their broadband cannot cope with them all using it at once.

item.title: Heartbreak and hope in a bank's Covid hotline call centre
item.description: Currently Santander bank's coronavirus call handlers answer around 400 calls a day. That's down from a peak of more than 1,000 in the first week after lockdown began.

item.title: Retired doctor bottles it on the million pound question but still pockets £500,000
item.description: Andrew Townsley, a retired doctor from Glasgow, decided to play it safe and take the £500,000 after correctly answering the first 14 questions on ITV's Who Wants To Be A Millionaire?

item.title: Rihanna soars to third in the list of Britain's richest musicians
item.description: Rihanna has surged to third place thanks to her cosmetics brand Savage X Fenty which powered her above Sir Elton John, said to be worth £360million in the Sunday Times annual rich list.

item.title: Repeated blunders by officials over Trident upgrade leave the project £1.3bn over budget
item.description: The astonishing extra cost to the public purse was blamed by the Commons public accounts committee on avoidable errors and poor management.

item.title: Social butterflies are able to cope with isolation just as well as introverts
item.description: Researchers surveyed more than 800 UK and US adults in lockdown and found that a preference against solitude was not significantly more likely to lead to ill effects.

item.title: Sea turtles dig decoy nests and leave false trails to protect their eggs from predators
item.description: A team of researchers from the University of Glasgow watched hawksbill turtles and leatherback turtles laying their nests over several years on the island of Tobago.

item.title: Prehistoric ANCHOVIES evolved terrifying fangs and an enormous sabre-tooth 66million years ago
item.description: Two fossils, found in Belgium and Pakistan, were found and analysed using high resolution CT scans and this revealed the bizarre dentition.

item.title: Dozens of prehistoric, Roman and medieval sites are discovered by lockdown archaeologists
item.description: Researchers from the University of Exeter asked teams of volunteers to search through LiDAR images and aerial surveys to hunt for signs of ancient sites.

item.title: Dogs are less obedient when they hit puberty, study shows
item.description: Dogs become less obedient to commands from their main carer during adolescent just like teenage kids, according to a new study.

item.title: Mother-of-three opens up about the horrific 'ritual abuse' she suffered from nuns in new book
item.description: Marie Hargreaves, 66, from Oldham, opened up about her traumatic childhood in her book The Convent, where she relates the sexual, physical and sexual abuse she suffered in a convent.

item.title: Britain's COVID-19 death toll could DOUBLE to 73,000 by next year if 10% of people catch the virus
item.description: Research by University College London and the University of Cambridge suggests one in five people in England fit into a vulnerable group which raises their risk of dying if they catch COVID-19.

item.title: Yet ANOTHER study finds that hydroxychloroquine did not help treat coronavirus patients
item.description: A new study from researchers in New York o found there was no difference in mortality rates between patients who took hydroxychloroquine, azithromycin, both drugs or neither of them.

item.title: Personal trainer runs lockdown aerobics class for herstreet...while standing on a portable toilet
item.description: Residents in one London street have been treated to their own weekly fitness class. Every Monday evening, personal trainer Flo Dowler clambers on a huge portable toilet and runs a 30-minute class.

item.title: Oldest fossilized salamander ever discovered lived 230 million years ago in Russia
item.description: A fossilized creature unearthed in Russia stretches just one-inch and has been deemed the oldest remains of a salamander to be discovered in written history.

item.title: Police prevents riot at Bolivia's worst prison where 'three inmates died of COVID-19'
item.description: Bolivian police thwarted a riot at a prison Monday following the deaths of three inmates who developed COVID-19 symptoms. Only one prisoner was confirmed of dying from the deadly bug.

item.title: Jacob Rees-Mogg tells MPs to 'set an example' to public and return to Westminster within weeks
item.description: The Commons leader said he did not want temporary arrangements - with MPs joining debates via webcam - extended beyond the Whitsun recess, starting on May 20 and ending June 2.

item.title: Ryanair accused of avoiding multi-million pound refund bill with plans to put on 1,000 daily flights
item.description: Ryanair (left) was last night accused of avoiding a multi-million pound bill for refunds by announcing plans to restore 40 per cent of its flights, which is around 1,000 flights a day, this summer.

item.title: John Torode suffers ANOTHER cooking disaster as his homemade sauce EXPLODES all over the kitchen
item.description: Masterchef star John Torode isn't having much luck cooking during lockdown.

item.title: Which star's brood of chickens really rules the roost, asks ALISON BOSHOFF
item.description: ALISON BOSHOFF: The rich and famous are potty about poultry and as is the case with celebrity trends, it's all about who's top of the pecking order.

item.title: Terrifying moment pickup truck rolls over and nearly flies into oncoming traffic
item.description: Floyd Grass, 43, was detained after he pulled over his white pickup truck into a grassy sidebar on westbound I-40 in Oklahoma.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: House prices predicted to fall 7% this year
item.description: Knight Frank said prices had probably already fallen 5%, as the Government revealed the property market can reopen immediately.

item.title: BBC Hospital viewers 'heartbroken' as COVID-19 patient, 73, dies from the deadly disease
item.description: BBC Hospital viewers were left heartbroken after COVID-19 patient Stanley, 73, who was 'determined' to beat the virus, died after spending nine days in London's Royal Free Hospital's ICU.

item.title: Abusive vicar or wounded veteran?
item.description: Rev Parks believes PTSD he suffered after serving in Northern Ireland during the Troubles sparked his 'controlling and coercive behaviour'... and the couple are now speaking out to raise awareness.

item.title: Scotland suffers one of the coldest May days for 23 years thanks to 1,000-mile wide Polar Vortex
item.description: Snow flurries are forecast overnight on Tuesday over Scotland's hills with the mercury plummeting to -5C, before the chill eases on Friday as temperatures rise to 15C by the weekend.

item.title: Three in four care homes say GPs won't visit residents with coronavirus
item.description: A third of homes have taken hospital patients with the virus, despite fewer than half being able to isolate them and control further spread.

item.title: Dr. Fauci says coronavirus vaccine trials could be successful by 'late fall'
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci warned Tuesday that reopening cities and states too quickly could trigger an outbreak that would get out of control and turn the clock back on efforts to fight the coronavirus.

item.title: Trump tweets support for Elon Musk after he reopened Tesla plant in defiance of California lockdown
item.description: Trump weighed in on the war between Tesla and California officials on Tuesday, tweeting: 'California should let Tesla and @elonmusk open the plant, NOW. It can be done Fast & Safely.'

item.title: Police officer is airlifted to hospital with serious injuries
item.description: The police officer, who had been responding to an incident, was driving along London Road in St Albans, Hertfordshire, when his police car slammed into a brick wall and overturned.

item.title: Could insect repellent neutralise coronavirus? MOD hands spray to soldiers on Covid front line
item.description: Citriodiol - which is found in MosiGuard - is being given to British soldiers, with Defence Secretary Ben Wallace confirming a study to better understand a potential utility in the fight against the virus.

item.title: SARAH VINE: As Ryan the plumber says, we don't need a handbook to follow the lockdown rules
item.description: SARAH VINE: When it comes to the latest Government guidelines on the (very) gradual lifting of lockdown, it seems people fall into one of two camps.

item.title: Property market will reopen TOMORROW... but estate agents are advised to stick to online viewings
item.description: Housing Secretary Robert Jenrick has told estate agents they can reopen immediately although they are being urged to use online viewings.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES: Boy Wonder Rishi Sunak returns to splurge another £10bn
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: The Boy Wonder returns! Rishi Sunak came bouncing back into Parliament yesterday, which these days can mean only one thing. Another splurge of Government cash.

item.title: Nurse's desperate diary strips bare the scandalous state of our care homes
item.description: Coronavirus has ravaged Newfield Nursing Home in Sheffield, where half of the residents have tested positive. Clinical lead nurse Laura Hibbard recounts a harrowing week on the front line.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sacked Amazon employee warns staff are at risk
item.description: Designer Emily Cunningham was fired from Amazon in April after speaking out. On Tuesday she slammed the 'culture of silencing' that comes from the top of the retail giant.

item.title: Twitter will allow employees to work remotely permanently
item.description: Twitter announced Tuesday it will allow employees to work remotely permanently, as the coronavirus outbreak forces companies to make unprecedented changes in offices across the globe.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump avoids Pence to keep Pelosi from presidency
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence was spotted at the White House on Tuesday wearing a face mask amid concerns about a coronavirus cluster at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue.

item.title: Former Olympic gymnast earns TikTok fame by showing off her insane flexibility at 47
item.description: Aurelia Dobre competed for Romania in the Seoul Olympics in 1988, where she helped the team to win a silver medal.

item.title: Nurse injured in knife rampage at Co-op writes heart-breaking apology letter to church warden
item.description: NHS worker Lisa Way, 53, was also injured in the attack inside a village Co-op where grandfather John Rees, 88, was killed as his wife Eunice waited in the car outside.

item.title: Pictured: Woman who was strangled to death 'by policeman lover'
item.description: Claire Parry, 41, was found injured in a pub car park in West Parley, Dorset, where she was allegedly strangled by constable Timothy Brehmer.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: BA pilots may work for RAF as airline struggles
item.description: Pilots' union BALPA is in talks with the air force to send pilots into RAF roles. They have discussed secondments between 18 to 48 months but it depends on BA's cooperation.

item.title: Meghan Markle wants 'Finding Freedom' book released NOW
item.description: Meghan Markle wants the upcoming biography on her and Prince Harry's life to be released sooner rather than later, DailyMail.com can reveal.

item.title: David Beckham sports drastically thinning locks during shopping trip in the Cotswolds
item.description: The father of four, 45, who is in lockdown at his country home, ventured out without one of his signature hats, with his thinning locks hard to miss.

item.title: Coronavirus cluster of 25 cases in Edinburgh is traced back to a Nike conference
item.description: A BBC Scotland Disclosure investigation revealed more than 70 Nike employees from around the world attended a conference at the Hilton Carlton Hotel in Edinburgh on February 26 and 27.

item.title: Lava tubes on Mars could serve as natural settlements that protect humans from deadly radiation
item.description: Scientists want to use lava tubes on Mars as habitats for the first explorers of the Red Planet. Radiation exposure drops by 82% in the caverns and can be closed off to create a breathable environment.

item.title: Q&A: How coronavirus furlough scheme extension affects you
item.description: The Government has extended furlough to avoid a wave of job losses, but there will be changes. We explain why and what it means.

item.title: Up to 150 mourners snub social distancing rules in Chelsea
item.description: Some people are still willing to flout the social distancing rules after a large gathering met in Ixworth Place in Chelsea to follow a funeral procession on Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: Charlton Athletic captain Jason Pearce's £60,000 Mercedes stolen from his driveway in the night
item.description: CCTV footage from a neighbour's house showed thieves getting inside Jason Pearce's (inset) Mercedes Benz GLE at 2.30am and driving off in it. The 32-year-old defender is appealing for help.

item.title: Millie Mackintosh walks newborn baby daughter in pram
item.description: The former Made In Chelsea star, 30, looked effortlessly stylish in double denim as she enjoyed the walk through West London with her manager.

item.title: Imposing lockdown sooner could have prevented 2,000 coronavirus deaths in Scotland, study finds
item.description: University of Edinburgh researchers said eight out of 10 coronavirus deaths in Scotland could have been prevented if the measures were brought in on March 9 instead of March 23 (shown).

item.title: Bored Britons turn to booze and snacks in lockdown: Alcohol and food sales surge
item.description: Britons who are still in employment were found to be spending an average of £107 a week on groceries, alcohol, entertainment and hobbies - a 10% increase compared with pre-lockdown levels.

item.title: Royals join together to pay tribute to nurses on International Nurses Day in touching video
item.description: The Queen, 94, led the royal family in tributes to healthcare workers across the world as they celebrate International Nurses' Day amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Severe complications TWICE as likely in smokers
item.description: In a new study from University College London in the UK, severely ill coronavirus patients with COPD had a 63% risk of suffering complications compared to 33.4% of patients without COPD.

item.title: New Spotify features let parents view kids' playback history and block specific content
item.description: The streaming giant says that two new features being rolled out will now allow parents to view their kids' listening history and also block specific content that they may find objectionable.

item.title: Rory Kinnear reveals his disabled sister Karina has died from coronavirus aged 48
item.description: Rory Kinnear has revealed his disabled sister Karina has died from coronavirus aged 48.

item.title: Suspected ISIS gunmen kill two babies plus 12 mothers and nurses in Afghanistan
item.description: Three gunmen dressed as police officers stormed a maternity hospital in the Afghan capital of Kabul on Tuesday morning before throwing grenades and opening fire, killing two newborns and 12 others.

item.title: Woman shares clever 'dinosaur egg' hack for cutting an avocado so it stays fresh and green for DAYS
item.description: Margaret Drisi shared the trick on TIkTok on April 30. She makes a single avocado last a week by cutting it open at the top and scooping out the fruit with a spoon.

item.title: Czech national, 27, is jailed for seven months after killing businessman on a motorcycle
item.description: Zdenek Pulko, 27, failed to look in his wing mirrors as he pulled out into the path of Ian Stewart, 63, on Coldhill Lane near Sherburn-in-Elmet, North Yorkshire.

item.title: Golfers scramble to book tee times as courses in England prepare to reopen on Wednesday
item.description: Clubs up and down the country have been closed for almost two months as part of the coronavirus lockdown, with many having to furlough staff in order to survive.

item.title: Coronavirus infections do NOT start with a fever in most children, small study finds
item.description: A small study from Tongji Hospital in Wuhan, China, found that four of five pediatric patients first had gastrointestinal issues before they were diagnosed with pneumonia and the coronavirus.

item.title: Artist's amazingly realistic paintings of American landscapes appear to blend into the background
item.description: Aaron Shuerr's subjects range from thawing rivers running through the icy mountain range at Yellowstone to gnarled trees poking out of plains of toasted grass at Anza Borrego Park in California.

item.title: A (spooky) Night At The Museum
item.description: Those who patrol the London museum at night have noted several strange occurrences, with mysterious footsteps, music and ghostly crying plaguing the institution's halls.

item.title: Coronavirus Russia: Kremlin spokesman infected, cases hit 232k
item.description: On Tuesday, Russia reported a further 10,899 cases of the coronavirus, taking Russia's total to 232,243, surpassing the total in the UK and Spain, and is now second only to the U.S.

item.title: Feel like you're boozing too much during lockdown? Expert shares top tips for mindful drinking
item.description: Jacob Briars, global head of advocacy and education and all round alcohol guru at Bacardi, told FEMAIL it's important to drink mindfully particularly during this time as we adapt to a new normal.

item.title: Rich heir who is 'addicted' to spending his father's £4million fortune bonds with a rough sleeper
item.description: Jay Warren, 24, who lives in Cambridgeshire, realises that he shared the same trauma as 20-year-old rough sleeper Reese on 5Star's Rich Kids Go Homeless, airing Wednesday.

item.title: Cherie Blair reveals she wishes she'd put more effort into her appearance
item.description: Cherie Blair, 65, spent ten years in 10 Downing Street while husband Tony was Prime Minister and told The Big Issue she hadn't anticipated there would be so much interest in how she looked.

item.title: Wanted Albanian murderer who spent 22 years on the run fights extradition from UK
item.description: Defrim Iseberi, 45, killed a security guard at the Gjallica Hotel in Kukes, Albania in 1997, before fleeing to the UK and claiming to be Kosovan refugee.

item.title: France and Germany have got public transport up and running so why can't TfL?
item.description: Germany and France both restarted their public transport networks with social distancing in place as lockdowns eased in recent days, but TfL is struggling to repeat the feat in London.

item.title: Six-year-old girl is knocked off her bike when couple refuse to get out her way on footpath
item.description: Video shows the little girl riding her bicycle down Blackwell Trail in Derbyshire with her father before she crashed into a dogwalking couple who rowed with the girl's daughter.

item.title: Scientists admit they can't tell male and female dinosaurs apart
item.description: Male and female dinosaurs may have looked similar due to only slight differences in bone structure, according to a new study.

item.title: Premier League star seen at lockdown party with Love Island contestants
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The midfielder, 21, was filmed chatting with friends at the Bank Holiday gathering near the O2 Arena in Greenwich, central London, in a now-deleted video posted on Snapchat.

item.title: Russian oligarch's son fights to keep details of his riches secret
item.description: The son of a Russian billionaire businessman is fighting to stop detail of his personal financial information being made public after becoming embroiled in his divorced parents' battle over money.

item.title: Arthur Edwards says Kate Middleton's photography is getting 'better and better'
item.description: Royal photographer Arthur Edwards praised Kate Middleton's portraits of Prince Louis, taken at Anmer Hall in Norfolk, to mark his second birthday, saying her photos always make people smile.

item.title: Horrified family discovers 6ft python swallowing a bird whole as it dangles from their washing line
item.description: The huge serpent paid no attention to Stuart McKenzie, the snake catcher sent to deal with it, as it dangled from a washing line in Buderim, Queensland, swallowing an entire corella bird.

item.title: Shopkeeper, 40, 'murdered his two children while wife was in shower' in their flat in Iflord, London
item.description: Prosecutors allege Nadarajah Nithiyakumar, 40, murdered his children Pavinya, aged 19 months, and her three-year-old brother Nigish Nithiyakumar at their home in Ilford, east London.

item.title: Amazon are selling VERY hard 1000-piece puzzle which is all one colour
item.description: Puzzlers have been left stumped by a very hard 1000-piece puzzle being sold on Amazon - which is all one colour. The jigsaw, which comes in either all black or all white,

item.title: Britain will endure MORE lockdowns in future unless government changes its 'dangerous' stance
item.description: An independent group of scientists say the PM's aim of flattening infections and ensuring the NHS is not overwhelmed until a vaccine is ready is 'foolish'. Britain should prepare for more outbreaks, they say.

item.title: 'Threats won't work on us!' Chinese state media warns the US it should stop 'blackmailing'
item.description: A new commentary from China Central Television Station demanded 'certain American politicians' ditch their 'Cold War mentality'. It claimed that 'blackmail or threats won't work' on Chinese people.

item.title: Police arrest more than 270 suspects and seize weapons and drugs worth £60,000
item.description: A huge drugs sting has unearthed hundreds of people looking to move illegal substances around the UK. Often being exploited by gangs, some individuals have chosen to dress as key workers.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: CPS decision to charge homeless man questioned
item.description: Sultan Monsour, 45, of no fixed address, was arrested at London's Liverpool Street station and charged with being 'outside of the place where you were living, namely of no fixed address'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: ONS data suggests true death toll near 45,000
item.description: Data from the Office for National Statistics shows that 38,333 people had died across the UK by May 1, 39 per cent higher than the official death toll at the time (27,510).

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 32,490 with 425 new fatalities
item.description: Today's victims were announced as a report from the Office for National Statistics revealed the true number of people to have died in England and Wales alone was already at 35,044 by May 1.

item.title: Gardening improves happiness and 'emotional wellbeing' as much as physical exercise
item.description: A new study by Princeton University found getting outdoors and gardening was particularly beneficial for women in low income households

item.title: Virgin Atlantic announces recovery plan to fly to 24 destinations in 2021
item.description: Virgin Atlantic confirmed today it will operate flights from London Heathrow, Manchester, Glasgow and Belfast to 24 destinations next summer, using only twin-engine aircraft.

item.title: Home of Israeli footballer arrested after gang rape vandalised
item.description: Women's groups have refused to drop their protests against Shimon Yusupov following the sex ordeal suffered by a British teen. They wrote: 'Here lives in peace with himself the Chief Rabbi.'

item.title: Parents of missing estate agent Chelsie Dack, 23, are informed as woman's body is found on shore
item.description: The body was discovered last night at Sizewell in Suffolk - 30 miles from Miss Dack's home town of Gorleston in Norfolk, where she vanished last month.

item.title: LG may be working on 'Wing', a dual-screen smartphone with a swiveling display
item.description: LG may be working on a two-screen smartphone, code named 'Wing', in which the 'sub screen' is only revealed when the top is swiveled horizontally - allowing multiple features to run at once.

item.title: Labour's Anneliese Dodds says she will REFUSE to send son Freddie, six, back to school
item.description: She said she would be worried that infants in classrooms would help spread the disease claiming the Government had not produced enough evidence it was safe for classes to restart

item.title: Bagpipes carried at the Battle of the Somme are rediscovered
item.description: The poignant memento, pictured, is believed to have belonged to Private William Alexander Scott, who went 'over the top' on July 1, 1916 armed only with his musical instrument.

item.title: More than HALF of COVID-19 patients caught the virus from someone before they showed symptoms
item.description: Researchers in Dublin reviewed 17 studies across the world to estimate between 33 and 80 per cent of transmission occurs in the 'presymptomatic' period.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Fears furloughed staff enjoying 'paid holiday'
item.description: Bosses are struggling to persuade some staff to come back as the lockdown eases with some people openly refusing or asking a colleague to go back in their place.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Matt Hancock's 'ill-tempered' TV interviews
item.description: The Health Secretary's off-guard moment came during a series of ill-tempered interviews where he was grilled on whether the Government's 'road map' was confusing.

item.title: 1980s pleasure seekers enjoy the summer sun at Butlin's holiday camp
item.description: The 'particularly wet summer' of 1982 was captured by photographer Barry Lewis at the seaside resort in Lincolnshire, with images of 'Knobbly Knees' competitions and Redcoat entertainers.

item.title: Hunt for the Camberwell Covid thug who SPAT at bus driver
item.description: Three men and a woman had boarded a 68 London bus travelling towards Camberwell on Walworth Road. After an argument over fare, one of the group spat at the bus driver and left.

item.title: Hunt for the Camberwell Covid thug who SPAT at bus driver
item.description: Three men and a woman had boarded a 68 London bus travelling towards Camberwell on Walworth Road. After an argument over fare, one of the group spat at the bus driver and left.

item.title: Tube is a 'suicide mission', complain commuters: Thousands of commuters pack onto London Underground
item.description: Ministers today told Sadiq Khan he must 'ramp up' London Underground services 'as quickly as possible' after commuters warned getting to work is like a 'suicide mission'.

item.title: Rapist's 'lenient' jail sentence increased to 16 years on appeal
item.description: Wilfred Marodza, 28, was originally sentenced for 14 years in January after threatening to kill the graduate before making her strip and raping her in Dickens Fields in Borough, London last July.

item.title: London Victoria ticket office worker Belly Mujinga died from Covid-19 after man spat at her
item.description: Ticket officer worker Belly Mujinga, 47, was working at Victoria Station in March when a man who said he had Covid-19 spat at her and a colleague. Within days she was admitted to Barnet Hospital, where she died.

item.title: Nosy e-scooter rider is so busy watching police that he crashes into their parked patrol car
item.description: The embarrassing incident was shared in a video posted by police in Swanley, Kent, where officers had gone to arrest two suspects for public order offences.

item.title: M&S launch Colin the Caterpillar cake delivery service amid the coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Marks and Spencer has launched a cake delivery service on a selection of birthday treats - including Colin the Caterpillar. The gift bag costs £20 but includes veggie Colin sweets and a balloon.

item.title: Commuters urged to face away from other passengers and wear a mask
item.description: People who must use public transport should avoid rush hour and consider getting off at an earlier stop to carry out some of their journey on foot, according to new guidance.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: TV and film production crews can start filming again in Britain
item.description: Production has been derailed by the pandemic on various soaps such as EastEnders and Coronation Street (left) as well as on hit UK dramas including Peaky Blinders and Call The Midwife.

item.title: Moment cyclist is left sprawling on the floor after crashing with a van…. but who is in the wrong?
item.description: Social media has been divided over who should shoulder blame for the crash at the Stoneferry Roundabout in Hull yesterday.

item.title: Interior designer will walk away with £60MILLION after divorce
item.description: Simrin Choudhrie and her multi-millionaire private equity firm boss husband Bhanu Choudhrie had fought over tens of millions of pounds at hearings in London's High Court.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Business leaders warn health and safety demands will be 'a challenge'
item.description: The Trades Union Congress said existing laws already protect employees in Britain who have a legal right to refuse to work if the risks are 'serious and imminent'.

item.title: Singapore Changi Airport is world's best airport for eighth time
item.description: The Asian hub has scooped the top gong at the 2020 Skytrax World Airport Awards, with Tokyo's Haneda International coming second.

item.title: Man charged with manslaughter after Butlins fight led to death
item.description: Michael Loughlin died after he was punched once during a fight at Butlins in Bognor Regis, West Sussex. Billy Mongey, 32, of Wandsworth, London, is charged with manslaughter.

item.title: My Feet Are Killing Me!: Swimmer gets surgery on 'alligator feet'
item.description: Jefferson, from Atlanta, told how he walks on his toe nails because his middle toes all curl over, so the nail curls over with them. He will appear in Quest Red's My Feet Are Killing Me!

item.title: EasyJet founder offers £5m reward to 'whistleblower' who can help scrap Airbus deal
item.description: In an open letter, Sir Stelios Haji-Ioannou said he is 'willing' to pay the cash out of his own pocket. Sir Stelios says easyJet can not afford the deal and wants it canceled.

item.title: Mexican cops seize gold-plated AR-15 assault rifle after arrest
item.description: Víctor Iván N., known as 'El Yori', was captured last week in Tehuacán, in the central Puebla state. He was allegedly in possession of crystal meth as well as the ostentatious assault rifle.

item.title: Harry Dunn's parents welcome Interpol arrest warrant for Anne Sacoolas after fatal motorbike crash
item.description: Charlotte Charles and Tim Dunne have welcomed the news that Interpol has issued a Red Notice on Anne Sacoolas, who is accused of causing the death of their son Harry by dangerous driving.

item.title: Celebrity fitness coach grandmother, 63, shares bikini pictures
item.description: Lesley Maxwell, 63, from Melbourne, shared a photograph of herself aged 23 posing in a tiny bikini and recreated the shot in March to prove that you can be in good shape and look yourhful at any age.

item.title: Adolescents who sleep more deal with stress and change better
item.description: Chinese researchers collected data from 840 students through questionnaires and found those with better sleep routines were more resilient.

item.title: Japanese grandmother captures heartwarming moments between her poodles and grandchildren
item.description: A Japanese grandmother delights followers with photos of her standard poodles, Kuu, Rickun and Gakkun, granddaughter Mamechan, and grandson Mugikun, as they play games and have tea.

item.title: Father and son cannibals who beheaded an ex-cop and cooked his body parts are jailed in Ukraine
item.description: GRAPHIC CONTENT WARNING: Maxim (left) and Yaroslav (right) Kostyukov, 42 and 21, were convicted of killing Yevgeny 'Zhenya' Petrov, 45, in Ukraine.

item.title: Subway reopens up to 150 of its 600 UK eateries today
item.description: McDonald's is the latest big name to announce a reopening with 30 drive-thrus to open next Wednesday (May 20) across UK and Ireland - with all 900 open by early June.

item.title: Game of Thrones star Rose Leslie's family using castle as holiday venue without planning permission
item.description: The family of Game of Thrones actress Rose Leslie are using 12th-century Wardhill Castle in Aberdeenshire as a holiday retreat without planning permission.

item.title: Apple is working on a pair of 'augmented reality 5G' glasses
item.description: Apple is working on a pair of augmented reality (AR) glasses that support 5G networks, according to a leaker familiar with the tech giant.

item.title: People reveal the VERY brutal reasons they dumped someone
item.description: People from across globe have taken to anonymous confession app Whisper to reveal what made them dump their love interests, including one man who always had to consult his twin on any decision.

item.title: Wuhan doctor whose skin turned dark due to coronavirus sees his colour slowly returning to normal
item.description: A picture of Dr Yi Fan shows the Wuhan medic almost looking like his old self on May 9. He was reportedly discharged by a hospital in Wuhan last week after beating the killer infection.

item.title: Agony for new parents of baby boy given just weeks to live due to rare gut condition
item.description: Luke Evans, 30, and wife Sophie, 27, have been forced to take it in turns spending time with four-month-old son Arlo in his final days due to hospital regulations during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Detective who photographed Great Train Robbery dies aged 86 after stroke
item.description: DC John Bailey took the fingerprints and photographs on board the Royal Mail train following the infamous heist in Buckinghamshire in 1963.

item.title: Fiona Bruce is criticised after calling bus drivers, care workers and security guards 'low skilled'
item.description: Footage of the BBC News anchor saying people with occupations such as bus drivers, care workers and security guards are 'low skilled' during Monday's 6:30pm bulletin sparked an angry backlash.

item.title: Bread-making tutorial goes hilariously wrong when baker ends up with a face full of flour
item.description: The baker chats away in Spanish as she kneads out her dough in the clip, believed to be filmed in Chile. The board is not fully on the table as she starts rolling it out sending it flipping over.

item.title: German cannibal who ate a man he met online has been allowed out of prison on day trips
item.description: Murderer Armin Meiwes, 58, was given 'sunglasses and a cap' to hide his identity and then driven to another state in Germany for walks.

item.title: Three women aged 20, 21 and 39 are arrested for murder of newborn baby girl
item.description: The baby was found dead beneath a street lamp on a cobbled residential road in Portsmouth city centre on the morning on January 25 (police are pictured searching the scene).

item.title: Paul Merson says hit ITV reality show Harry's Heroes saved his life
item.description: Football legend Paul Merson has laid bare his bitter struggles with alcohol and gambling addiction, which saw his body operating on at least '35 pints a week.' The ex-pro unloaded to the Mirror.

item.title: Police seize ten tons of Class A drugs globally since March as lockdowns make life hard for gangs
item.description: The National Crime Agency (NCA) said that the price of heroin has doubled under lockdowns in countries where drugs are sourced, such as Pakistan and Colombia.

item.title: Frustrating multiple-choice quiz puts your ability to solve baffling riddles the test
item.description: The 15-question challenge was shared on US-based Playbuzz by creator Michael Rogers, who claimed it is so tough that it is 'impossible' to score full marks.

item.title: Florida street cats see off curious dog when he ventures into their territory
item.description: Dog Tuesday was on a walk with his owner in Tampa, Florida, when the curious pooch approached the cluster of four felines. One bold move caused an unnerved cat to launch itself into the air at him.

item.title: A BALCONY of one's own: DIY enthusiasts transform tiny spaces into mini gardens
item.description: DIY enthusiasts from across the UK have transformed their tiny balconies into mini garden havens using artificial grass, pots plants and fairy lights to brighten up life in lockdown.

item.title: Normal People's intimacy coach reveals lead actors 'never touched genitals'
item.description: BBC Three's Normal People had a total of 41 minutes of sex scenes, yet it was so well carefully choreographed, the lead actors never touched genitals.

item.title: Woman, 27, told she could lose the 'whole right side' of her nose after skin cancer diagnosis
item.description: Lauren Coathup, 27, from Chelmsford, Essex, was told she could lose the 'whole right side' of her nose and some of its cartilage after a small lump turned out to be skin cancer.

item.title: How many skincare products should you REALLY apply before bed? And why you should wear moisturiser
item.description: The experts from the Australian interior design company Bed Threads have explained the importance of applying moisturiser every night before bed.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... easing the lockdown
item.description: 'There were only two passengers allowed on the train, Poirot - this should be a doddle'

item.title: Six Tongan schoolboys were stranded on island for 15 months in real Lord of the Flies
item.description: The boys, all aged between 13 and 16 and pupils at a strict Catholic boarding school on Nuku'alofa, 'borrowed' a fisherman's boat in 1965 with ambitions of travelling to Fiji or New Zealand.

item.title: Travel firms try to charge fees and taxes over cancelled holidays
item.description: Some travel firms are punishing disappointed holidaymakers further, by charging excessive fees or deducting large sums in 'unrecoverable taxes'.
